explains: v. 以高人一等的态度对待；（经常）惠顾；赞助（patronize 的现在分词）
adj. （说话、行为）自认为高人一等的

sentences.en: The tone of the interview was unnecessarily patronizing.
sentences.cn: 这场会面的语气屈尊得很没必要。

sentences.en: I was only trying to explain; I didn't want to sound patronizing.
sentences.cn: 我只是想解释一下而已，绝无自诩清高之意。

sentences.en: Barzun's response seemed a little patronizing, though he undoubtedly hadn't intended it that way.
sentences.cn: 巴曾的反应好像显得有点屈尊俯就，但无疑他不是想要那样。
